required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Opinions of Healthcare Providers About Neuromodulation
clinical_study.official_title: Opinions of Healthcare Providers About Neuromodulation for Pain: an Online Survey

brief_summary.textblock: The goal of this online survey is to gain further insight in the goals, expectations and definition of success for neuromodulation for pain, according to healthcare providers.

primary_outcome.measure: Physician goals, evaluated with a self-constructed question.
primary_outcome.time_frame: Cross-sectional evaluation during 2nd Joint Congress of the INS European Chapters (e-INS 2021) in Paris in September.
primary_outcome.description: Goals of physicians to treat patients with neuromodulation for pain.

primary_outcome.measure: Physician expectations, evaluated with a self-constructed question.
primary_outcome.time_frame: Cross-sectional evaluation during 2nd Joint Congress of the INS European Chapters (e-INS 2021) in Paris in September.
primary_outcome.description: Factors that respondents expect to change according to neuromodulation for pain.

primary_outcome.measure: Physician definition of success, evaluated with a self-constructed question.
primary_outcome.time_frame: Cross-sectional evaluation during 2nd Joint Congress of the INS European Chapters (e-INS 2021) in Paris in September.
primary_outcome.description: Physician definition of success of neuromodulation for pain.

intervention.description: Physicians are asked to fill in an online survey regarding 1) goals to treat patients with neuromodulation for pain, 2) factors that respondents expect to change according to neuromodulation for pain and 3) their definition of success of neuromodulation for pain.

study_pop.textblock: Male and female adults who are involved in the management of chronic pain and more specifically in neuromodulation for pain (including but not limited to anesthesiologists, neurosurgeons, nurses).The survey will be spread at the 2nd Joint Congress of the INS European Chapters (e-INS 2021) in Paris from 2/9/2021 to 4/9/2021.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Male and female adults who are involved in the management of chronic pain and more specifically in neuromodulation for pain (including but not limited to anesthesiologists, neurosurgeons, nurses).
Exclusion Criteria:
- Not involved in management of chronic pain through neuromodulation.
